alert.note: Alert for Grant (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 8:49PM MDT until August 14 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico and southwest New Mexico, including the following counties, in south central New Mexico, Sierra. In southwest New Mexico, Grant. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in SOuth of Kington and Iron Creek. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - SOuth of Kington and Iron Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Lake Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
